law.text: The permittee or other person shall establish on the regraded areas, and all other lands affected, a diverse, effective, and permanent vegetative cover of the same seasonal variety native to the area of land to be affected and capable of self-regeneration and plant succession at least equal in extent of cover to the natural vegetation of the area; except, that introduced species, such as the establishment of pollinator habitat sites for bees, may be used in the revegetation process where desirable and necessary to achieve the approved postmining land use plan.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 19, sec. 4, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 429, sec. 30, effective July 14, 1992. -- Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 330, sec. 8, effective May 3, 1978.
